amendment.description: Amendment sought to prohibit the use of funds in the bill to make payments in lieu of taxes (PILT) with respect to certain Federal lands when it is made known to the official responsible for making these payments that a State, county, or local government has asserted a formal claim of ownership to these lands.
amendment.purpose: An amendment printed in the Congressional Record of July 13, as amendment No. 71, that prohibits the use of funds in the bill to make payments in lieu of taxes (PILT) with respect to certain Federal lands when it is made known to the official responsible for making these payments that a State, county, or local government has asserted a formal claim of ownership to these lands.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Skaggs amendment (A039) Failed by voice vote.
